item.title: The EARN IT bill is back, seeking to scan our messages & photos
item.description: - The EARN IT Act seeks to create a government commission to set "best practices" for internet websites and apps while allowing state governments to encourage lawsuits and criminal prosecutions against those who do not follow these practices.

item.title: CATL has announced a new "condensed" battery with 500 Wh/kg
item.description: - CATL, the world's largest battery manufacturer, has announced a new "condensed" battery with a density of 500 Wh/kg that will go into mass production this year.

item.title: Tell HN: Eid Mubarak
item.description: - The post is a celebratory message for the Muslim holiday of Eid al-Fitr.

item.title: GitHub Copilot emits GPL code
item.description: - GitHub Copilot is being sued for training on non-permissively licensed code, exposing users to legal risks.

item.title: Tech bosses are letting dictators censor what Americans see
item.description: - Chinese and Indian censorship laws are increasingly determining what people in free countries, including the United States, can do online.

item.title: Windows on Btrfs
item.description: - Windows on btrfs driver enables file sharing between Windows and Linux dual-boot and fully supports both operating systems.

item.title: Inkscape is hiring: Accelerating the GTK4 migration
item.description: - Inkscape is hiring a senior C++ developer with experience in gtkmm and an Inkscape expert to accelerate the GTK4 migration.

item.title: The weird world of Windows file paths
item.description: - Windows file paths are more complicated than Unix paths - There are three kinds of absolute Windows paths: Drive paths, UNC paths, and device paths - Relative paths on Windows can be defined relative to the current directory, the root of the current drive, or a drive's current directory - There are restrictions on the characters and lengths of file names in Windows paths - Windows paths can be constructed in many different ways to refer to the same directory

item.title: Nuclear Power Is the Answer to Global & Environmental Energy Woes
item.description: - Only nuclear power can meet global energy demands while being carbon-free and reducing dependence on oil and gas.

item.title: Office of the President of Mongolia: Top to bottom text on the web
item.description: - The Office of the President of Mongolia has implemented a top-to-bottom text feature on their website.
